alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Scott (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 9:27AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Scott and northern Harrison Counties through 1000 AM EST... At 927 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Williamstown to 8 miles north of Georgetown. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Scott and northern Harrison Counties, including the following locations... Robinson, Colemansville, Breckinridge, Alberta, Renaker, Mallard Point, Rutland, Berry, Boyd and Claysville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EST for central Kentucky.
